News & Announcements

  1. ArtWeek Amherst 2019

    ArtWeek Amherst 2019 is coming April 26-May 5, via the Amherst Center Cultural District and MCC grant funds. Highlights include the display of the brightly painted Pakistani Truck Art trolley in front of the Visitor Center for Art Night Plus on May 2nd. Read on...

  2. West Bay Rd Construction Continues Week of April 8, 2019

    Palmer Paving, Martins Construction, and Amherst Public Works crews will continue work on West Bay Road next week, Monday through Friday. The road will remain open to traffic but will be reduced to one travel lane. Read on...

  3. Amherst Parking Forum

    The Town of Amherst and parking consultants Nelson\Nygaard invite you to a forum on parking in downtown Amherst. Doors open at 5:30PM and the program begins promptly at 6PM. We hope you can attend to learn about parking and Read on...

  4. Cuppa' Joe w/ Paul & Director of Senior Services Nancy Pagano

    Town Manager Paul Bockelman will be at Bangs Community Center in Amherst on Friday, April 12th from 7:30 – 9:00 a.m. Stop by…he will bring the Coffee! Paul will be joined this time by the Town’s Director of Senior Services, Nancy Pagano. Read on...

  5. 14th Annual Human Rights Hero Awards

    The Amherst Human Rights Commission’s primary purpose is to promote a community of mutual respect and to honor the diversity of our community. We strive to promote attitudes of compassion and concern for our neighbors. Read on...

  6. Street Sweeping

    The Town of Amherst Department of Public Works has begun sweeping the Main routes and hills that receive the most sand during the winter months. After completing these areas the DPW will begin sweeping the various sections of town, if all goes well Read on...

  7. Amherst Leisure Services Receives Agency Award

    The Massachusetts Recreation and Parks Association (MRPA) has awarded the Town of Amherst, Leisure Services and Supplemental Education Department its Agency Award for the Department’s recreational program outreach. This award Read on...

  8. Scheduled water Main Flushing

    The Water Division of the Public Works Department will begin its annual systematic water main flushing programs to clean the distribution system on Monday, April 22, 2019 (weather permitting). Water Division personnel will be flushing daily from Read on...

  9. Volunteer Spotlight: Rebecca Woodland

    The Town of Amherst will be highlighting some of our amazing volunteers in the new Volunteer Spotlight series. Our first spotlight features Amherst Personnel Board volunteer, Rebecca Woodland. Rebecca is an associate professor of Educational Leadership at Read on...

  10. Open Air Burning Permits now available

    State regulations allow for home owners to burn brush from January 15th through May 1st each year. You must first obtain a permit from the Fire Department which requires an initial inspection. Get you permit NOW for use anytime between now and May 1st. Read on...

  11. She Leads Amherst

    For International Women's Day we attempted to highlight some of our amazing female staff. We hope to be able to capture everyone next year. Pictures can be viewed Read on...

  12. Town Council Seeks Members to Serve on Town Committees

    The Town Council is seeking volunteers to serve on several Town committees that may have vacancies now or beginning in July, including the Finance Committee (Section 5.5(b)), Planning Board (Section 2.9(c)), Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) (Section 2.9(c)) Read on...

  13. Eversource Maintenance Notifications

    Eversource is providing notice of planned and scheduled vegetation maintenance work on the transmission right-of-way (ROW) that is located within Amherst town limits this year. The planned maintenance will involve floor cutting, side Read on...

About Amherst

  1. The Town of Amherst, located in the lovely Pioneer Valley of Western Massachusetts, is a diverse, inclusive community offering numerous educational and cultural opportunities.

    Host to Amherst College, Hampshire College, and the University of Massachusetts at Amherst, the Town enjoys a tradition of open, professional, and high level of government services, quality education, support for open space and agriculture, and respect for its history.
  1. Town Hall  |  4 Boltwood Avenue  |  Amherst, MA 01002  |  Ph: 413-259-3333  |  info@amherstma.gov
